channel.title: Posts on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Plugin Architecture with Needlr in .NET: Building Modular Applications
item.description: Learn how to build modular .NET applications using Needlr's plugin system, including IServiceCollectionPlugin, IWebApplicationPlugin, and automatic plugin discovery. Link to article: https://www.devleader.ca/2026/02/15/plugin-architecture-with-needlr-in-net-building-modular-applications

item.title: Boost Your .NET Projects with Spargine: Centralized Time Handling with the Clock Type
item.description: The Clock type in the DotNetTips.Spargine.Core assembly and NuGet package centralizes time-related functions to enhance application consistency and reduce fragmentation. It provides a comprehensive and reliable abstraction for developers, ensuring efficient time handling while minimizing bugs. By streamlining time operations, Clock fosters cleaner, more predictable code across applications. Link to article: https://dotnettips.wordpress.com/2026/02/15/boost-your-net-projects-with-spargine-centralized-time-handling-with-the-clock-type/

item.title: 2 Weeks of Claude Code for Me
item.description: I‚Äôm busy all the time with the Critter Stack tools, answering questions on Slack or Discord, and trying like hell to make JasperFx Software go. I‚Äôve admittedly had my head in the sand a bit about the AI tools for coding, thinking that what I do being relatively novel for the most part and that ‚Ä¶ Continue reading 2 Weeks of Claude Code for¬†Me ‚Üí Link to article: https://jeremydmiller.com/2026/02/14/2-weeks-of-claude-code-for-me/

item.title: DPO Fine-Tuning Using Microsoft Foundry SDK
item.description: In the rapidly evolving landscape of large language models (LLMs), achieving precise control over model behavior while maintaining quality has become a critical challenge. While models like GPT-4 demonstrate impressive capabilities, ensuring their outputs align with human preferences‚Äîwhether for safety, helpfulness, or style‚Äîrequires sophi Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/foundry/dpo-fine-tuning-using-microsoft-foundry-sdk

item.title: Customize AI agent browsing with proxies, profiles, and extensions in Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Browser
item.description: Today, we are announcing three new capabilities that address these requirements: proxy configuration, browser profiles, and browser extensions. Together, these features give you fine-grained control over how your AI agents interact with the web. This post will walk through each capability with configuration examples and practical use cases to help you get started. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/customize-ai-agent-browsing-with-proxies-profiles-and-extensions-in-amazon-bedrock-agentcore-browser/

item.title: Modernize WPF Desktop applications to ASP.NET Core MVC with Amazon Q Developer
item.description: Introduction A medical imaging customer recently approached our team with a need to modernize their legacy Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) Framework desktop applications into ASP.NET Core MVC Web applications. They wanted to use an agentic approach to speed up their modernization to achieve the up to 4x speed that other customers have realized with Amazon [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/dotnet/modernize-wpf-desktop-applications-to-asp-net-core-mvc-with-amazon-q-developer/

item.title: Llms Need Mark as Answer
item.description: Introduction Today‚Äôs LLMs have already ingested basically all of the publicly available information they can to build their models. In order to improve further, they‚Äôre going to need to seek out additional sources of information. One obvious such source is the countless interactions they have with their users, and while privacy concerns are certainly relevant here, for the purposes of this article I want to focus on another issue: quality signals.

item.description: If you‚Äôve worked with local language models, you‚Äôve probably run into the context window limit, especially when using smaller models on less powerful machines. While it‚Äôs an unavoidable constraint, techniques like context packing make it surprisingly manageable. Hello, I‚Äôm Philippe, and I am a Principal Solutions Architect helping customers with their usage of Docker.¬†In... Link to article: https://www.docker.com/blog/context-packing-context-window/

item.title: Building Modular Monoliths With Kotlin and Spring

Over a decade ago, Netflix became one of the early adopters of microservice architecture, showcasing its potential at a large scale. Since then, many companies have jumped on the microservices bandwagon, building their backends this way from day one. While microservices offer isolation and independent scaling, their [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2026/02/building-modular-monoliths-with-kotlin-and-spring/

item.title: Microsoft at DevNexus 2026: Practical AI for Real-World Java Development
item.description: Java developers face a tough trifecta: keeping mission-critical systems running, modernizing legacy apps, and weaving AI into real engineering workflows, all without increasing risk. At DevNexus 2026, the Microsoft Java team is tackling these challenges head-on. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/java/microsoft-at-devnexus-2026-practical-ai-for-real-world-java-development

item.title: AI meets HR: Transforming talent acquisition with Amazon Bedrock
item.description: In this post, we show how to create an AI-powered recruitment system using Amazon Bedrock, Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases, AWS Lambda, and other AWS services to enhance job description creation, candidate communication, and interview preparation while maintaining human oversight. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/ai-meets-hr-transforming-talent-acquisition-with-amazon-bedrock/

item.title: Build long-running MCP servers on Amazon Bedrock AgentCore with Strands Agents integration
item.description: In this post, we provide you with a comprehensive approach to achieve this. First, we introduce a context message strategy that maintains continuous communication between servers and clients during extended operations. Next, we develop an asynchronous task management framework that allows your AI agents to initiate long-running processes without blocking other operations. Finally, we demonstrate how to bring these strategies together with Amazon Bedrock AgentCore and Strands Agents to build production-ready AI agents that can handle complex, time-intensive operations reliably.

You can power your generative AI applications with Nemotron capabilities using the managed deployment capabilities offered by SageMaker JumpStart.

We'll dive deep into strategies for optimizing performances for the application with these errors. Whether this is for a fairly new application or matured AI application, in this post you will be able to find the practical guidelines to operate with on these errors. Link to article: https://aws.

item.title: Iberdrola enhances IT operations using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
item.description: Iberdrola, one of the world‚Äôs largest utility companies, has embraced cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionize its IT operations in ServiceNow. Through its partnership with AWS, Iberdrola implemented different agentic architectures using Amazon Bedrock AgentCore, targeting three key areas: optimizing change request validation in the draft phase, enriching incident management with contextual intelligence, and simplifying change model selection using conversational AI. These innovations reduce bottlenecks, help teams accelerate ticket resolution, and deliver consistent and high-quality data handling throughout the organization.

item.title: Building real-time voice assistants with Amazon Nova Sonic compared to cascading architectures

We also provide guidance on when to choose each approach to help you make informed decisions for your voice AI projects. item.title: Implementing strongly-typed IDs in .NET for safer domain models
item.description: As developers, we know that user requests can be unpredictable. When they request data, it is either successfully returned or not found. However, a "not found" result usually happens in two ways. First, the user might request a record, such as a basketball player, by passing an ID Link to article: https://blog.elmah.io/pimplementing-strongly-typed-ids-in-net-for-safer-domain-models/

item.title: Open Source in Focus: .NET Projects and the Tools Behind Them
item.description: At JetBrains, we love seeing the developer community grow and thrive. That‚Äôs why we support open-source projects that make a real difference ‚Äì the ones that help developers learn, build, and create better software together. We‚Äôre proud to back open-source maintainers with free licenses and contribute to initiatives that strengthen the ecosystem and the people [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/blog/2026/02/10/open-source-in-focus-dotnet-projects-and-the-tools-behind-them/

item.title: Automated Reasoning checks rewriting chatbot reference implementation
item.description: This blog post dives deeper into the implementation architecture for the Automated Reasoning checks rewriting chatbot. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/automated-reasoning-checks-rewriting-chatbot-reference-implementation/

item.title: Time Travel in Azure SQL with Temporal Tables
item.description: Applications often need to know what data looked like before. Who changed it, when it changed, and what the previous values were. Rebuilding that history in application code is tedious and error prone. This is especially valuable when exposing a database to an AI agent through MCP servers like SQL MCP Server, where information discovery mat Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/time-travel-in-azure-sql-with-temporal-tables

item.title: Scale LLM fine-tuning with Hugging Face and Amazon SageMaker AI
item.description: In this post, we show how this integrated approach transforms enterprise LLM fine-tuning from a complex, resource-intensive challenge into a streamlined, scalable solution for achieving better model performance in domain-specific applications. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/scale-llm-fine-tuning-with-hugging-face-and-amazon-sagemaker-ai/

item.title: New Relic transforms productivity with generative AI on AWS
item.description: Working with the Generative AI Innovation Center, New Relic NOVA (New Relic Omnipresence Virtual Assistant) evolved from a knowledge assistant into a comprehensive productivity engine. We explore the technical architecture, development journey, and key lessons learned in building an enterprise-grade AI solution that delivers measurable productivity gains at scale. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/new-relic-transforms-productivity-with-generative-ai-on-aws/

item.title: Accelerate agentic application development with a full-stack starter template for Amazon Bedrock AgentCore
item.description: In this post, you will learn how to deploy Fullstack AgentCore Solution Template (FAST) to your Amazon Web Services (AWS) account, understand its architecture, and see how to extend it for your requirements. You will learn how to build your own agent while FAST handles authentication, infrastructure as code (IaC), deployment pipelines, and service integration. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/accelerate-agentic-application-development-with-a-full-stack-starter-template-for-amazon-bedrock-agentcore/

item.title: Agent-to-agent collaboration: Using Amazon Nova 2 Lite and Amazon Nova Act for multi-agent systems
item.description: This post walks through how agent-to-agent collaboration on Amazon Bedrock works in practice, using Amazon Nova 2 Lite for planning and Amazon Nova Act for browser interaction, to turn a fragile single-agent setup into a predictable multi-agent system. Link to article: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/machine-learning/agent-to-agent-collaboration-using-amazon-nova-2-lite-and-amazon-nova-act-for-multi-agent-systems/

item.title: What should I do if a wait call reports WAIT_ABANDONED?
item.description: If you call a wait function like Wait¬≠For¬≠Single¬≠Object and receive the code WAIT_ABANDONED, what does it mean and what should you do? The documentation says that WAIT_ABANDONED means that you successfully claimed a mutex, but the thread that previously owned the mutex failed t Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20260209-00/?p=112049

item.title: Automatic Service Discovery in C# with Needlr: How It Works
item.description: Learn how Needlr's automatic service discovery works in C# with convention-based registration, type scanning, and the DoNotAutoRegister attribute for .NET applications. Link to article: https://www.devleader.ca/2026/02/09/automatic-service-discovery-in-c-with-needlr-how-it-works

item.title: Getting more information in MSBuild binlogs with property tracking
item.description: MSBuild binary logs (binlogs) are a powerful tool for diagnosing build issues. If you're not familiar with binlogs, check out my post Exploring a MSBuild binary log using the binary log viewer to get started, or Stop using diagnostic verbosity in MSBuild to understand why binlogs are better than diagnostic verbosity. By default, binlogs capture a lot of information, but you can get even more details about‚Ä¶ Link to article: https://www.

item.title: Bringing ChatGPT to GenAI.mil
item.description: OpenAI for Government announces the deployment of a custom ChatGPT on GenAI.mil, bringing secure, safety-forward AI to U.S. defense teams. Link to article: https://openai.com/index/bringing-chatgpt-to-genaimil

item.title: Testing ads in ChatGPT
item.description: OpenAI begins testing ads in ChatGPT to support free access, with clear labeling, answer independence, strong privacy protections, and user control. Link to article: https://openai.com/index/testing-ads-in-chatgpt

item.title: Isolate the swiyu Public Beta management APIs using YARP
item.description: This post looks at hardening the security for the swiyu public beta infrastructure. The generic containers provide both management APIs and wallet APIs which support the OpenID for Verifiable Presentations 1.0 specification. The management APIs require both network protection and application security. This post looks at implementing the network isolation. Code: https://github.com/swiss-ssi-group/swiyu-passkeys-idp-loi-loa Blogs in this [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://damienbod.com/2026/02/09/isolate-the-swiyu-public-beta-management-apis-using-yarp/
